intro: Epidendrum roezlii, commonly known as the Rösel's Epidendrum, is a species of orchid native to Central and South America. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and produces clusters of showy, fragrant flowers in shades of white, pink, and red. The plant typically has lance-shaped leaves that are covered in a dense layer of fine, white pubescence. It thrives in bright, indirect light and requires well-draining soil to prevent root rot. Epidendrum roezlii is popular among orchid enthusiasts for its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
